description: First off, I'm Italian from Rome so I have had a good pizza or two in my life. Montesacro was ridiculously overpriced. ri-di-cu-lously. Pizza was maybe a 5.5 out of 10. There is much better and cheaper places in SF you can go to
author: Gordon G.

description: Exactly what you want out of roman style food. Pizza or not, it is simply incredible, and the wine list is something you could use to impress anyone, from anywhere.
author: Imran K.

description: Holy cow. Best food I've had in a while. Super gritty locale (what up 6th street!!) but so worth it I can't even deal!
author: Emily G.

description: Food, Ambience, SF gem located in downtown. The pinsa are incredibly light, and full of flavors to accommodate every taste. Great selection of wine as well!
author: Lauren J.

description: Food is excellent. Montesacro pinsa was amazing!!!! Loved the panzenella salad. Amazing food wine and service. The chairs were absolutely the most uncomfortable chairs I've ever sat on in my life. Why?? Get new chairs everything else is perfect.
author: Stacey T.

description:
All I have to say is - GO HERE!! It is so good u will tell everyone about it. 

Order the marinated vegetables for sure. The pinsa is phenomenal. Old school Roman style, so flavorful. 

The owner is so sweet and the service is lovely. We felt like we were in Rome.
author: Alma H.

description: Delicious! Fresh, flavorful food. A wonderful spot for good wine, friendly service and a tasty meal - highly recommend!!!
author: Heather K.

description: Yum! The place is a little tight on space but the service, food and ambiance are wonderful. It's almost like being in Italy. The Pinza is delicious and the wine list is very well curated.
author: Gretchen W.

description: I liked the food. It was special but not too special. It is a pizza like food that the crust is beard instead which is baked in the restaurant. The ambiance is lovely. Photos of old Italy are everywhere. It was a nice experience.
author: Amin E.

description: The pinsas are fluffier than I expected, which was surprising, but on a second try I'm a fan. They all come with apparently authentic Roman toppings, and the cavalo nero salad was small but filling. Fellow diners liked the panzanella salad and the eggplant panini. The place is really cute inside as well, with a beautiful early 20th century bakery oven and pretty original tile floors. Glad to have something this nice in such an unexpected spot!
author: Rebecca L.

description: The maranella pinsa was delicious. Loved our server, very friendly. The place has a great ambiance - cool industrial feel, open, you can see the wood fire oven. Get there before 6pm for 2 for 1 happy hour (great wine)!
author: Gwendolyn B.

description: When I go out of town, this is the first place I go to eat. When I have friends and customers who want a new experience, I send them here. Montesacro's offerings are outstandingly tasty and make me feel like I am in Rome. The salads are fresh. The sliced meats are luscious (I crave the porchetta). The pinsa dough is the best I have ever had, anywhere.
author: Steven N.

description: Great pizzas, good salads, very nice ambiance - even for a group of 8. The wait staff was very knowledgable about the wine and was very welcoming. Like dining at the home of a dear friend.
author: Kate L.

description: This restaurant is AMAZING!  The location is in a scary alley, but once you get inside, you will feel much better. The menu is simple, however, it can be a bit overwhelming because it's in Italian. The waiter was great about providing recommendations and helped explain each item we were ordering.  The wine selection was unique and robust, the antipasti was so fresh and like nothing I've ever had, the kale salad (Cavolo Nero) was prepared to perfection, and the margarita PINSA was made with a delicious light crust topped with a tangy tomato sauce and fresh cheese that will make your heart melt!
author: Lindsey B.

description: We were looking for a place to eat after we saw a play at the Orpheum Theater.  Based on the Yelp reviews we decided to give it a try.  The location is down a side street in a not so good part of town but if you can get past that, you will be happy you did.  We were greeted and served by a warm & welcoming lady.  The food was delicious.  We tried 2 types of Pinsa type pizza, caprese, and a sliced pork called porchetta.  Everything was high quality and authentic.  As we left, the lady hugged us and thanked us. We felt like 'regulars'.  What a great find!  (Happy Hour from 4-6pm; lower prices on some dishes and two for one beer & wine)
author: Jamie E.

description: Great place for pizza Roman style! If you're never been to Italy come as this is what it feels like. Food from beginning to end is amazing. Excellent service! If your in SF please try Bella!
author: Carol P.

description: I really really wanted to like this place--it's in my neighborhood. Pizzas were small, overpriced, and not very good. Space is very nice. I wish the food was decent.
author: tim b.

description: Cute little pizzeria off the street. A true hole in the wall with good pizza. Not quite as good as Italy but good enough to be one of the better pizzas in town.
author: Sean C.

description: Know before going that this is restaurant is in the heart of the Tenderloin--if you're not from the area you may very well feel uncomfortable by your surroundings. Though the restaurant is tucked away in a well lit alley, the environment changes drastically even 300 ft from the door. The food is delightful -- light, fresh, flavorful,  and authentically Italian. The environment too; lively, joyful, and busy. The service is very poor, slow and inconsistent (we had four different severs throughout the meal). Much like the crowd that fills it, this restaurant sticks out like a sore thumb. Is the food worth the palpable feeling of sore thumbedness? Not in my opinion.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Good date spot. Feels like a hidden gem in a somewhat sketchy alleyway. Try to have a reservation. Service can be a little slow, but perfectly acceptable if you just want to hang out for a while.
author: Tom P.

description: Great restaurant!! A little hidden gem! The atmosphere and pizza makes you feels like youve been transported to Rome. Staff is very friendly and nice! The meat selection is also very yummy!
author: Z W.

description: What a cozy, romantic spot! My husband and I stumbled upon this gem for date night.  We had the amazing pinseria which you have to try!!!
author: Laura S.

description: Good pizza and excellent kale salad with anchovies.  Our server was very good.  Interesting ambience.  Be forewarned, this is in the worst neighborhood in San Francisco - only for the truly adventurous.  Tremendously uncomfortable chairs, probably resurrected from some faux italian cafe.  Having said that - I wish them luck as pioneers in Mid-market!
author: Glenn S.

description: This place is incredible and will no doubt blow-up (they only opened a couple of months ago but they were already busy for a Friday lunch). The owner Gianluca is charming - he came over several times and sat and talked to us about the food and the history. I had the radicchio and gorgonzola pinsa which I have been dreaming about since and am going back to have tonight.
author: Claudia B.

description: This place is a little pearl in the City. You will not easily forget the amazing Pinsa (finally a piece of ancient roman history available in Town), but also the wonderful environment: the whole place is in fact a piece of history in San Francisco. Not to mention the warm and always welcoming host and service!
author: Valentina G.

description: This is a great find in a rough and tumble section of mid-Market (just like the real Montesacro).  The pinse are fabulous, perfect executed and with flavors right on point.  Wine by the bottle is priced well, in a European fashion, and everyone in the front of staff (plus the chef) spoke Italian.  Can't get more authentic than that!  Got the Maranella, which was a flavor balance perfection.  Can't wait to go back --- may take Uber the next time.
author: Greg K.

description: I ll celebrate my baby shower here! food is amazing, i can't wait!
author: Francesca T.

description: Felt like we were in Rome in every regard. Fantastic pinsas and stellar wine list.  Arrange transport so you don't have to park.
author: Tina D.

description: The hostess was fantastic! Super helpful. Really cool ambiance. The food was delicious.
author: Kelsey H.

description: Wow--- love love love this place. We ordered the focaccia and montesacro pinsa. Super light and crunchy crust, flavorful and just the right amount of cheese. Felt like we were back in Italy. It was almost as if they lifted this restaurant right out of Rome and transported it over. Great service and ambience!
author: June C.

description: Incredibly delicious pizza. The crust was doughy and delicious, the cheese was bubbly and excessive, and the toppings were fresh and flavorful. Service is a little slow but the food was excellent. We ordered the sausage & broccoli Rabe and the mozzarella and infernetto.
author: Ann K.

description: Amazing little pizzeria, cute ambiance, delicious pizza, really attentive and sweet servers! We brought in a 12 person group for a birthday dinner and they were great! Tried a lot of different pizzas, the margherita and the sausage/broccoli were our favorites. Crust is amazingly delicious and the cheese is perfectly melted, one of my favorite pizza places in SF so far! We also brought a cake, and they were nice enough to find space in their fridge for it and cut it up for us :) come here!! You won't regret it!
author: Whitney C.

description: Delish meals at this authentic Italian eatery in one of SF's diciest transitional neighborhoods (6th street aka CRACK ALLEY).  The Pinsa's are really super, excellent wine list too.  Staff can be a little aloof and not always checking on you so that can be a challenge sometimes.  The dining chairs are quaint but somewhat small and uncomfortable.  The place is loud so can be a bit overwhelming.
author: King K.

description: Loved this place so much!!!  Found it by chance and can't stop thinking about it!  My husband and I shared the chartucerie and cheese platter (wonderful) and the smoked buffalo mozzarella and squash pinsa (loved it). The environment/vibe was so  perfect. It would be hard to "happen" upon this place in a sketchy alley, but thank goodness for Yelp!
author: Julie G.

description: On the edge of a tricky neighborhood, this is a little gem of authenticity and deliciousness. We showed up in a large party without a reservation.  The hostess/waitress deftly shuffled a few tables to fit us in with a warm and gracious welcome.  The food and wine are unbelievable. We shared three salads, each of which was wonderful, followed by 3 pinsas.  These are remarkable creations - a flatbread crust made of wheat flour, rice flour and soy flour with fresh and delicious toppings in perfect combinations. Apparently, this is the first "Pinseria " (a Roman specialty) in North America.  It is WELL worth a visit. We will be back.
author: A Z.

description: Wow. That's all I have to say about eating at this place. Was hesitant to try it because of the area but it really surprised me. The service was great and so was the food, I'll definitely be back again. It is was a great atmosphere, really authentic and had a great menu as well as wine list.
author: Benjamin H.

description: Great find !!! I was looking for a casual place to grab a good pizza and glass of wine. I didn't get much help from the locals. Found this gem on Yelp.  Overall great pizza and service. Highly recommend. I had the margarita pizza. As others have said its not traditional American pizza.
author: Wil J.

description: Hot place, I'm from Rome and this place really made me feel at home, food authentic roman and pizza, sorry Pinza was at least amazing! I'll be back for sure
author: Stefano G.

description: Food was good. Ambience was very nice, not a lot of people. Wait staff were knowledgable and suggested good dishes. Great for a casual lunch especially if you have some time to have a glass of wine with pizza. It was hard to find, they need some signs on 6th to direct foot traffic. It was recommended by a co-worker or I wouldn't have known it existed hidden on Stevenson.
author: Adrienne P.

description: Location of the restaurant was... interesting.  Seemed almost seedy, and I was a little uncomfortable parking or walking in the alley.  But once we set foot into the restaurant, the environment changed.  The decor was more or less what you would see in a lot of SF restaurant: smaller, more intimate space, high ceiling, got an air of the old and whimsy to it thanks to the collection of vintage kitchen tools and what-not's.  But it didn't feel pretentious.  Probably because the staff was friendly.  Food was excellent.  The whole experience reminded of my boyfriend of his experience in Italy, which said a lot.  We each ordered a pinsa, and we shared the prosciutto-wrapped cantaloupe.  That appetizer was delightful.  I've had it in other nicer restaurant, and somehow it never came out quite as good.  Not sure why since it's a pretty straightforward dish.
author: Rona S.

description: Hidden amazing authentic Italian. The hostess (very cute/ small woman) was so friendly- suggested a great wine while we waited then ended up getting us a table even though we didn't have reservations on. Friday night. Overall, the service was very good and the food was amazing!! So cool- I guess it used to be a bakery 100+ years ago! Highly recommend.
author: Melody N.

description: So happy that we found this restaurant!  The beet salad (generous with the beets) along with the Sott'oli (marinated veggies) was yummy. The pinsas were light & delicious!  The staff was so friendly that it felt like you were having dinner in an Italian home. I would highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Debbie C.

description: I usually don't write reviews. It has to be extraordinarily terrible or extraordinarily great. Thankfully, this was the latter. I stumbled in here looking for something close to my hotel and was pleasantly surprised. I know good pizza - I'm a fan of Antico in Atlanta and pizzeria Bianca in Phoenix and this met and even exceeded those standards. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a great pizza!
author: Katie C.

description: I almost never finish a meal - but I did this one!  Delicious, without getting too full.  Great wine & beer selection.  Wonderful, warm greeting upon entering and throughout.
author: Martin L.

description: Awesome restaurant in the tradition of Rome. Unique pinsas, which are Riman flatbread with varying toppings, fresh cooked. Great wine and cheese list.  Yummy salads. Inspiring space, an old bakery from the 1910's, with the giant oven left as an old relic-an iron and tile sculpture. Service excellent. Make this your next destination after a show.
author: Kim B.

description: Awesome Montesacro Pinsa. Highly recommended
author: Anitha K.

description: Went for the first time recently.  LOVED the pizza - okay, pinsa.  We went during happy hour and had two glasses of wine for the price of one, woo hoo!  We got a little plate of three prepared vegetables: dried tomatoes, eggplant, zucchini.  Tasty, but not essential, especially for $12.  Get to the pinsa!  We split two among three of us, which seemed just about right.  We had the Maranella (burrata, spicy sausage, broccolini) and it was very savory (could use a little more toppings; we also had the Collatina (mozzarella, arugula, cherry tomato, served uncooked on top of the crust)and this was okay, but not a special thing - you can do better.  I'm definitely going back to try more.
author: Laura H.

description:
Pizza is not the right word.  As the website says it's Pinsa -- like pizza but really quite different.  This is definitely not a "pizza place."  
First a call out to our waiter - Murphy.  We had a group of 10, and he gave us the most attentive service I've ever had for a large group!  He refilled glasses of wine and water regularly -- better service than I sometimes get with just two people.  Nothing bothered him.  Mahalo Murphy! 
This was a great place for a group, perhaps a bit noisy for a couple.  The pinsa are varied and amazing.  All were delicious (and we tried most of them!).  Antipasto selection is excellent, especially anything and everything with the mozzarella (OMG!).  Deserts were small but yummy.  One option is an Italian style biscotti with a special dunking wine (I think).
Note:  We had a Tuscan Italian in our group, and she gave the thumbs up on a truly crisp crust.  
Reasonably priced wine selections.  
Group table is on bar stools but no one in our group had a problem with this.
As others have said, this place is not in the best neighborhood but don't let that stop you.  We walked from Powell Muni/BART.  Others parked at 5th/Mission garage.
Everyone in our group said they are likely to return when in SF.
Price could be less than $30/person.  We hit more like $50 -- with, ahem, quite a few bottles of wine for the table.
author: B M.

description: Best pinseria in the city. Most toppings are marinated in-house and are delicious. The decor is unique and the service is great. Highly recommended.
author: Amit P.

description: We had the olives, cheese course and two mains. It truly felt like we were in Rome and the food was was delicious. Will definitely return.
author: Annah D.

description: We've been huge fans of 54 Mint for a long time...so we ventured to the new spot this weekend. 5 star reviews in SF are uneven, so we were not sure what to expect. You can expect it all at Montesacro: warm welcome, cool decor, wonderful ambiance, extensive wine list, and a first-class an unusual menu. There are many Italian lite restos in SF...this is not lite, it's THE REAL DEAL. Start with the sott'oli, divine, especially the tomatoes. We ordered a glass of sparkling red, which was delicious. An a bottle of red, which was well-priced and excellent. Then after much conversation and fun with the owner, Gianlucca, we ordered 3 pinsa. The only disagreement was which one of us had ordered best. The dough is unlike anything you've had before, it's crispy and light, and a perfect base. The toppings are fresh and well-thought out. Given the size, we figured we would need at least 2 take-out boxes. No...we ate everything. And given we were headed to the SFIFF to see Del Toro, this is saying a lot as we were going to be sitting for at least 3 hours after. I'm changing reservations for some company events to move them to Montesacro. So run, don't walk to get your res here, you will love it. The bar opens son for Happy Hour, and we will be there too. Don't let the hood put you off, it's right on the corner of Stevenson, and we know this will be a well-worn and welcoming path. Thank you for the REAL Italian, we felt like were were on a piazza overlooking a fountain somewhere in Italy. This is as close as you will get to Italy in SF, enjoy, enjoy!
author: S S.

description:
Heaven on skid row!
Eating here was a rare culinary revelation. Once you try Montesacro's pinsas you won't go back to pizza. Yes, their pinsas are that good. Crunchy yet light, thin yet bubbly, the kind of flavor that can finally culminate your quest for perfect pizza, and much more actually.
We tried Collatina (cherry tomato, arugula and buffalo mozzarella) and Margherita (just like the namesake pizza), both very good. Although the Collatina was my favorite. 
We also tried an antipasto of sottoli: grilled eggplant, zucchini and sun-dried tomatoes in good olive oil. I hadn't had that good sottoli since I left Italy. It was a great way to start our meal.
I thought prices were also reasonable, given the abundant quantity and excellent quality. We will definitely come back, and bring our friends, too. I look forward to try the other pinsas. This is a true diamond in the rough. Neighborhood is still sketchy, but never felt unsafe.
author: Stefano A.

description: I never write reviews, but the staff was so friendly and helpful and the food was so good that they deserve an amazing review. My boyfriend and I walked in without a reservation. Even though it was a very busy night for them, they managed to squeeze us in and promised us that our food would arrive quickly so we wouldn't be rushed to eat it. We wanted to get pizza, but we weren't sure if one or two pizzas would be enough food for us, so they recommended that we order one pizza and a platter with cheese and cured meats. They gave us bread to go with the meat and cheese, also. The cheese, meat, and bread were all so delicious. Then the pizza came. I can't remember what we ordered, but it had mozerralla cheese and mushrooms. The mushrooms were so good that they almost melted in our mouths, and the pizza crust was airy and soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. It was honestly the best pizza I've ever had. On top of all of this, the place was beautifully decorated. If you are looking for pizza, look no further. I will definitely be coming back soon.
author: Mariana G.
